intro: Blepharodon mucronatum, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub with upright stems and produces tubular flowers in shades of purple, pink, and white. It is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
